messages.message:
Hey I faced something similar the other day. It seems like the python vscode extension is continuously crashing and saving large core dumps in this path `/home/owner/.vscode-server/extensions/ms-python.vscode-pylance-2024.9.1/dist`
Doing an `rm core.*` in this folder freed up a ton of space for me. I’ve had to disable the python extension on the root dir for now.

A recent disk usage report from this folder
```owner@dev:~/.vscode-server/extensions/ms-python.vscode-pylance-2024.9.1/dist$ du -sh ./*

I would also recommend using ncdu to identify stuff that’s taking up a bunch of space 

https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05L87V014J/p1724091373339339?thread_ts=1724087093.899729&channel=C05L87V014J&message_ts=1724091373.339339 (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05L87V014J/p1724091373339339?thread_ts=1724087093.899729&channel=C05L87V014J&message_ts=1724091373.339339)
Removing the core.* files cleared 440 GB :lolcry:
